title: Standard Form
text: Write the equation in standard form. $$\frac{x^2}{a^2}-\frac{y^2}{b^2}=1$$.

title: Horizontal or Vertical
text: Determine whether the transverse axis is horizontal or vertical.

title: Horizontal or Vertical
text: If the $$x^2$$ is positive, then the transverse axis is horizontal, and if the $$y^2$$ term is positive, then the transverse axis is vertical.

title: Horizontal or Vertical
text: In our case, the transverse axis is horizontal since $$x^2$$ is positive.

title: Vertices
text: Since the transverse axis is horizontal, we want to find the vertices on the $$x$$ axis.

title: Vertices
text: To find the vertices, we find the square root of $$a^2$$ and the square root of $$b^2$$.

title: Vertices
text: In our case, a is $$\pm 5$$, and $$b$$ is $$\pm 2$$.

title: Asymptotes
text: Now, we must find the equations of our asymptotes.

title: Asymptotes
text: Since our transverse axis is horizontal, we will use the equations, $$y=\frac{b}{a} x$$ and $$y$$ $$=$$ $$-\left(\frac{b}{a}\right) x$$

title: Asymptotes
text: We then sketch our equations and draw the the different branches of the hyperbola with the asymptotes as guides.
